item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (615 points | 111 comments)
2. Any program can be a GitHub Actions shell (30 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (356 points | 137 comments)
4. Show HN: Lux – A luxurious package manager for Lua (179 points | 58 comments)
5. Cardiac arrest deaths among marathoners have decreased, study finds (52 points | 33 comments)
6. What Was Quartz? (58 points | 27 comments)
7. Beyond Quacking: Deep Integration of Language Models and RAG into DuckDB (45 points | 6 comments)
8. Scaffold Level Editor (71 points | 12 comments)
9. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (116 points | 45 comments)
10. Deleting multiplayer from the Unreal engine can save memory (9 points | 1 comment)
11. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (33 points | 7 comments)
12. Hasochism: The pleasure and pain of dependently typed Haskell programming [pdf] (2013) (73 points | 10 comments)
13. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (102 points | 32 comments)
14. Ancient Dagger Up to 2.5k Years Old W Stars/Moons/Geometric Patterns Unearthed (20 points | 2 comments)
15. 20 years of Git (216 points | 145 comments)
16. Rising odds asteroid that briefly threatened Earth will hit moon (25 points | 23 comments)
17. PiDP-1, or the rebirth of an old machine (74 points | 29 comments)
18. Show HN: Minimal MCP server in Go showcasing project architecture (27 points | 1 comment)
19. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (528 points | 420 comments)
20. In the 1980s we also downloaded software from TV (26 points | 14 comments)
21. The Troll Hole Adventure (31 points | 10 comments)
22. Glamorous Toolkit (300 points | 108 comments)
23. North Korean IT workers have infiltrated the Fortune 500 (16 points | 4 comments)
24. Benchmarking LLM social skills with an elimination game (163 points | 50 comments)
25. A startup doesn't need to be a unicorn (520 points | 319 comments)
26. Deterministic simulation testing for async Rust (91 points | 7 comments)
27. We asked camera companies why their RAW formats are all different and confusing (331 points | 198 comments)
28. The Mathematics of Crochet (101 points | 10 comments)
29. DeepMind program finds diamonds in Minecraft without being taught (231 points | 139 comments)
30. Circling the Good (26 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 3:00 AM UTC
